verbose_text: Finally, TNF-alpha expression is higher in the muscle of subjects with insulin resistance and non-insulin-dependent DM, suggesting an important role for TNF-alpha in the pathogenesis of human insulin resistance (as occurs in obesity and diabetes) [XREF_BIBR] and in obese patients TNF-alpha is secreted in excessive quantities by adipocytes, inhibiting the IR tyrosine kinase in muscle and fat (the two tissues mainly responsible for insulin stimulated glucose uptake) and promoting insulin resistance [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
evidence: TNF-alpha is secreted in excessive quantities by adipocytes, inhibiting the IR
